items.translated_title: From pixels to characters: The engineering behind GitHub Copilot CLI’s animated ASCII banner
items.content:
Learn how GitHub built an accessible, multi-terminal-safe ASCII animation for the Copilot CLI using custom tooling, ANSI color roles, and advanced terminal engineering.

The post From pixels to characters: The engineering behind GitHub Copilot CLI’s animated ASCII banner appeared first on The GitHub Blog.

items.title: Context windows, Plan agent, and TDD: What I learned building a countdown app with GitHub Copilot
items.creator: Chris Reddington
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Context windows, Plan agent, and TDD: What I learned building a countdown app with GitHub Copilot

images.alt: Screenshot of a conversation with Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code. Copilot has identified that the user wants to create a new workspace for a New Year countdown app using Vite, TypeScript and Tailwind CSS v4. It's going to to use the create_new_workspace tool to create the new workspace.

Screenshot of the input box for Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code. The input box contains a prompt with some requirements that configure an interactive timezone selector either like a time machine dial, or a mini world map.
: Screenshot of Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code. The agent selector shows "UI Performance Specialist", with a prompt asking the agent to review the plan and to provide implementation details.
Screenshot of Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code showing GitHub Copilot following a TDD cycle; failing tests first, then implementation.

Screenshot of Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code showing GitHub Copilot making implementation changes, running tests and identifying a test failure. Copilot iterates based on the failure, and re-runs the tests to obtain a green set of tests.

Screenshot from the countdown app. It has several dots placed for locations across the world, but the world map has rendered as a series of abstract shapes to represent islands, instead of a true version of the world map.
Screenshot of Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code showing an interaction where Copilot asks clarifying questions to confirm the requirements.
Screenshot from the countdown app, showing the timer has reached 0 and fireworks are being shown on screen to celebrate.

items.content:
Learn how I managed context to keep Copilot focused, used the Plan agent to sharpen vague requirements, and required Test Driven Development practices to catch bugs before users.

The post Context windows, Plan agent, and TDD: What I learned building a countdown app with GitHub Copilot appeared first on The GitHub Blog.

items.translated_title: Building an agentic memory system for GitHub Copilot

images.alt: A flow chart showing how Copilot agents store learnings worth remembering as they carry out their tasks.

items.content:
Copilot’s cross-agent memory system lets agents learn and improve across your development workflow, starting with coding agent, CLI, and code review.

The post Building an agentic memory system for GitHub Copilot appeared first on The GitHub Blog.
